Empowering
Fair Payroll Practices
whyUs.description: At Paynalyze, we are committed to protecting employees' rights by ensuring they receive fair and lawful compensation. Our AI-powered platform helps you easily verify payroll compliance, detect violations, and access legal insightsâ€”all in simple language.

about.title: Empowering Pay Transparency for Everyone
about.description: We believe knowledge is powerâ€”and your paycheck shouldn't be a mystery. Paynalyze is built to help employees uncover the truth about their wages using cutting-edge AI and labor law intelligence.

whatWeDo.title: What We Do and Why We Do It
description: At Paynalyze, we help workers discover if they're being fairly compensated - by scanning payslips and employment contracts, analyzing the data, and providing easy-to-understand legal reports.

Our journey began with a simple idea: too many workers are unaware of their rights. What started as a passion project grew into a mission to bring clarity, transparency, and fairness to workplaces everywhere.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: To give every worker the tools to understand, question, and take control of their payâ€”because justice begins with transparency.

coreValues.title: Empowerment
coreValues.description: Knowledge should be accessible to all.

coreValues.title: Fairness
coreValues.description: Every paycheck deserves a second look.

coreValues.title: Innovation
coreValues.description: We harness AI to simplify complex legal insights.

laborLawHelp.title: Understanding Labor Law Calculations

steps.step2: Step 2: What Data Do We Need?

overtimePay.lawDescription: In simple terms: If an employee works 11 hours in a day, they get:
lawDetails: Regular time: Hours 1-9 per day = 100% of hourly rate
First overtime tier: Hours 10-11 (first 2 overtime hours) = 125% of hourly rate
Second overtime tier: Hour 12+ (beyond 2 overtime hours) = 150% of hourly rate

minimumWage.lawDescription: In simple terms: Every employee must earn at least the minimum wage for every hour worked, regardless of their contract rate.
lawDetails: Adult workers (18+): Must be paid at least â‚ª30.70 per hour
Youth workers (16-18): Must be paid at least â‚ª21.49 per hour (70% of adult minimum)
Apprentices: Must be paid at least â‚ª24.56 per hour (80% of adult minimum) during training
Overtime: Additional premiums apply on top of minimum wage

vacationPay.lawDescription: In simple terms: When employees take vacation, they must be paid their regular daily rate for each vacation day taken.

common.useAbsForDifferences: Use abs() for differences and comparisons
common.useRoundForFinal: Use round() for final display values

common.alwaysTest: Always test your formulas with real data

common.secondOvertimeTier: Second overtime tier: Hour 12+ (beyond 2 overtime hours) = 150% of hourly rate
